intro: Cyperus unispicatus, commonly known as the narrowleaf flatsedge, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the grass family Cyperaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia, often found in wetland habitats such as marshes and seasonally flooded areas. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet at the tip of each flowering stem, which is a distinctive feature. Cyperus unispicatus is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in moist conditions.
